titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the James, Meadows & Howard Records 1893-1974 (bulk 1951-1971)
titlestmt.author: This finding aid was prepared by Buffalo History Museum staff.

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using local best practices.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: The records of the architectural firm of James, Meadows & Howard represents the accumulated archives of a firm dating back ninety years.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Description and dates], Box/folder number, Mss. C74-2, James, Meadows & Howard Records, 1893-1974 (bulk 1951-1971), Research Library, Buffalo History Museum.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: James, Meadows & Howard Records, 1893-1974 (bulk 1951-1971), are open for research.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright of papers in the collection may be held by their authors, or the authors' heirs or assigns. Researchers must obtain the written permission of the holder(s) of copyright and the Buffalo History Museum before publishing quotations from materials in the collection.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: Two ledgers from this collection were digitized by the LIS 567 Digital Libraries class of the University at Buffalo's Department of Library and Information Studies. The collection is located at: http://www.bechs.org/Greenstone/green/index.php

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection reprocessed and retroconverted by Peter Nelson, 8 June 1992.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Buffalo architectural firm which originally began as Green & Wicks in 1884. It became Edward B. Green & Son in 1917 and, upon the death of the son in 1933, Edward B. Green. R. Maxwell James joined the firm in 1930 as a designer and became a partner in Green & James in 1936. Rufus W. Meadows, who joined as a designer in 1936, became a partner in Green, James & Meadows in 1945. When Mr. Green died in 1950, the partners continued under the name James & Meadows. Lewis E. Howard, Jr., a former associate, rejoined Green, James & Meadows in 1946. In 1953 he became a partner in James, Meadows & Howard. The firm's designs included the Federal Reserve Bank on South Elmwood Avenue, and buildings in the Buffalo General Hospital and Children's Hospital complexes, Erie County Medical Center, and at the University of Buffalo. Mr. Howard died in 1956. The firm was dissolved in 1974.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records of the architectural firm of James, Meadows & Howard represents the accumulated archives of a firm dating back ninety years. The records include log books, construction specification books, bids, contracts, plans and blueprints, correspondence, invoices, site photographs and other records of an architectural firm of local importance commissioned to design a wide variety of structures, including many hospitals, churches, banks and other commercial buildings.
Specifications for Falconwood Club, Buffalo Historical Society Building, Clifton Park Memorial, Crippled Children's Home, and Albright Art Gallery Transferred from Iconography section, 1975.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
This collection is arranged in four series:
I. Log Books
II. Construction Specifications
III. Job Files
IV. Miscellaneous Photographs, Concrete Site Reports, Cost Books and Contracts.
The archival practice of maintaining the original arrangement of the firm's records has been carefully observed here. Alphabetical arrangement within series.
